channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At least 18 migrants die after boat sinks near Greek island of Crete
item.description: The migrants were attempting to cross the Mediterranean Sea in an inflatable boat when it capsized south of the island of Crete, Greek authorities sai...

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: Teen's sister looks to TikTok to help solve 25-year-old murder mystery
item.description: With her posts and pleas on TikTok, Molly Bish's sister Jennifer hopes she will generate new tips that will finally solve her sister's Massachusetts m...

item.title: Staff and tourists among 25 killed in Goa nightclub fire
item.description: Officials believe a gas canister explosion triggered the fire which tore through the busy nightlife venue.

item.title: Ukrainian city hit by 'massive' strike as peace talks in US conclude
item.description: Russia carried out strikes on Kremenchuk, while its defence ministry said it had shot down 77 Ukrainian drones in several locations.

item.title: Death toll from devastating Indonesia floods passes 900
item.description: More than 100,000 homes were destroyed when powerful rains lashed the South East Asian country last week.

item.title: 12/6: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Pete Hegseth doubles down on boat strikes: “We will find you and we will sink you;" Karl Bushby nears the end of his walk across the world over 27 yea...

item.title: Japan is facing a dementia crisis – can technology help?
item.description: Japan's ageing population is putting strain on national budgets and society as a whole, but researchers are developing solutions to ease the pressure.

item.title: A new museum in Doha celebrates Indian art legend MF Husain
item.description: Lawh Wa Qalam is dedicated to the late Indian artist whose prolific paintings fascinated the world.

item.title: 12/6: Saturday Morning
item.description: The U.S. is facing record-low temperatures and severe weather. Meanwhile, President Trump was awarded a peace prize at the FIFA Men's World Cup draw.

item.title: At least 23 killed in nightclub fire in India
item.description: The blaze occurred just past midnight in Arpora in North Goa, a party hub.

item.title: National parks fee-free calendar drops MLK Day, Juneteenth and adds Trump's birthday
item.description: The Trump administration, which has railed against what it describes as "woke" policies, removed MLK Day and Juneteenth from next year's list of fare-...

item.title: Putin finds a warm welcome in India
item.description: Professor Šumit Ganguly, Director of the Huntington Program at Stanford's Hoover Institution, says Putin's visit to India reflects ongoing ties despit...

item.title: 7 deaths and hundreds of injuries are linked to faulty Abbott glucose monitors
item.description: About 3 million glucose monitoring sensors were potentially affected by a production error that caused incorrect low glucose readings.

item.title: Waymo will recall software after its self-driving cars passed stopped school buses
item.description: Waymo is issuing a software recall for its self-driving cars after reports the company's autonomous vehicles failed to stop for school buses.

item.title: Man wounded in 2nd stabbing attack on North Carolina commuter train since August
item.description: Police in North Carolina have charged a 33-year-old man with stabbing someone on a commuter train in Charlotte.

item.title: Sheriff hunting for the last of 3 inmates who escaped from a Louisiana jail
Magnitude-7.0 earthquake hits in remote wilderness along Alaska-Canada border
